result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Mack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by DOC.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years  if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted if stay is lifted.
Perform 25 hour of community service for a non-profit or government agency.

supervisions.notes: Good time and Huber privileges granted. 30 days to report.
$1031.63 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 in case no. 17-CF-62.

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, approved. Maintain absolute sobriety, etc.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Kelly Mack in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Revocation Order and Warrant. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
from Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, I cannot grant a furlow until the person is sentenced. This request is premature.

by State

Defendant waives reading of Information. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Counts 2-5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defendant forgot paperwork, hoped to fill one out today, questions how DAGPA works. State advises of offer. Court reviews details. Defendant questions jail time, wants to accept offer. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Defendant waives prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Defendant at window sick.  Judge Diltz moved case to next week Monday, May 2, 2016 at 10 a.m.  Contacted Melanie in DA's Office and defendant was told the new date at the window. lw

Defendant Kelly Mack in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with DA. Defendant advises of offer, hasn't really had a chance to look at it. State advises of details of offer. Court clarifies offer. Defendant wants to think about it for a week. Court advises Defendant to fill out plea questionnaire if he wants to accept offer.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received tax refund, but got other bills, wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant, who advises of mixup on W2, isn't getting big enough refund, has to have someone else look at taxes.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is waiting on W2 to do taxes so he can see if he can afford an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kelly Mack in court with attorney John F. Peterson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding whether or not Defendant would qualify. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense requests status conference to allow Defendant time to contact PD's office to see if he qualifies.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Door County Jail

Defendant Kelly Mack appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/25/16, 10:00.
